title: Fault
description: The fault object used to hold in-house Vodafone values for an error occurring within a middlewarecomponent

fault-cause.description: The legacy fault from the backend system.

name.description: A human readable short text name for the fault. Required if the Error Code >= 100, may be omitted or set to

severity.description: The degree of severity and impact the fault has inccured, provides an indication of the level that may be used to trigger different behaviours in the consumer. Required if the Error Code >= 100, may be omitted or set to Information if the object is being used to indicate success.

category.description: A classification of the fault indicating whether it has been generated through some technical aspect of the interaction or on account of a failure of business logic, rules or processing. It provides an indication of the type that may be used to trigger different behaviours in the consumer. Required if the Error Code >= 100, may be omitted or set to Business if the object is being used to indicate success.

reason-code.description: An enumeration of the reasons why the fault has been generated by the provider. Currently this is not used.

message.description: A human readable description of the fault as identified by the Error Code. Required if the Error Code >= 100, may be omitted or set to

characteristic.description: A characteristic of the fault; these have both a name and a value.

failure.description: A component that describes individual failures within the fault. This component is used to support multiple causes to the fault; i.e. where the fault is generated from one or more API calls or one or more validation failures.

code.description: The code identifying the specific failure.

text.description: The human-readable text of the specific failure.

data-ref.description: A reference to the specific field or component within the VBO that generated the failure.

path-name.description: The pseudo-JSON Path reference to the specific field or component within the VBO.

path-value-text.description: The value of the field referenced by the Path Name.

severity.description: The degree of severity and impact the fault has inccured, provides an indication of the level that may be used to trigger different behaviours in the consumer. Required if the Error Code >= 100, may be omitted or set to Information if the object is being used to indicate success.
